newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 1.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Tuesday's Daily Variety:

* Broadcasters won a surprise victory when the Supreme Court voted 5-4 to uphold a law requiring cable systems to carry local TV stations, even if those stations offer little more than home shopping or religious programming.

* The Supreme Court's decision to uphold the must-carry law lifted stocks of broadcasters such as Barry Diller's HSN Inc and pummeled stocks of cable operators, cable programmers and satellite TV providers.
* Television anchor Diane Sawyer has decided to stick with Walt Disney's ABC News, at least for two more years.
* Anthony Edwards is turning to film and TV projects for Time Warner's Warner Bros.

* Time Warner's TNT has made deals with a number of actors and executive producers, including Michelle Pfeiffer, Dennis Quaid, Goldie Hawn and Danny Glover, to film a batch of original movies to run on the network from fall 1997 through the end of 1998.

* Hollywood crews are calling for a maximum 14-hour workday following the death of an assistant cameraman last month who may have fallen asleep at the wheel while driving home from a marathon shoot of New Line's "Pleasantville."
